extendedIngredients.aisle: Nut butters, Jams, and Honey;Health Foods
extendedIngredients.name: honey

recipes.title: Curry Candy Pecans

winePairing.pairingText: Sparkling rosé and Sparkling Wine are my top picks for Fingerfood. If you're serving a selection of appetizers, you can't go wrong with these. Both are very food friendly and complement a variety of flavors. The Bellissima Sparkling rosé with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 24 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Bellissima Sparkling Rose
productMatches.description: This is an elegant, bright rosé, with hints of strawberry and grapefruit, and a soft, persistent foam. Uncorked at the very last minute, Bellissima Sparkling Rosé pairs perfectly with smoked salmon, shellfish, and seafood hor d’oeuvres such as tuna tartare, sushi, and sashimi.

recipes.instructions: Procedures                                                                              1                                                                            Preheat oven to 250° F and line large rimmed baking sheet with foil.                                                                                                                            2                                                                            Mix onion powder, garlic salt, curry powder and cayenne in small bowl. (Because I don't use onion powder much, I needed to break it up with a small fork.)                                                                                                                            3                                                                            Melt butter and honey in a saucepan over medium heat.  Add pecan halves, stir to cover all the nuts with butter/honey mixture. Remove from heat.                                                                                                                            4                                                                            Add spice mixture and toss to coat evenly. Spread pecans in single layer on the foil-covered baking sheet.                                                                                                                            5                                                                            Bake pecans until dry and toasty, about 40 minutes. Take off of pan and cool completely on waxed paper. Separate the pecans. This mixture stores for up to 1 week.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 250° F and line large rimmed baking sheet with foil.
Mix onion powder, garlic salt, curry powder and cayenne in small bowl. (Because I don't use onion powder much, I needed to break it up with a small fork.)
Melt butter and honey in a saucepan over medium heat.
Add pecan halves, stir to cover all the nuts with butter/honey mixture.
Add spice mixture and toss to coat evenly.
Spread pecans in single layer on the foil-covered baking sheet.
Bake pecans until dry and toasty, about 40 minutes. Take off of pan and cool completely on waxed paper. Separate the pecans. This mixture stores for up to 1 week.
